result.execSummary:
The defendant Liu Yongguang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. 

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall have no contact with Y. L. or his residence.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order to Reimburse Washington County for Attorney Fees
for Payment of Fees for Attorney Brian Borkowicz, $1,042.16

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Liu Yongguang in court.  Attorney Brian Michael Borkowicz in court for Liu Yongguang.  Interpreter appearing in person: Shirley Barker by zoom.  No contest plea entered to Count 1 and Count 2.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and Count 2 and enters judgment.  Court orders atty. reimbursement of $100.00/month commencing 8-15-2022.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Liu Yongguang in court.  Attorney Brian Michael Borkowicz in court for Liu Yongguang.  Interpreter appearing by zoom:  Shirley Barker.  Counsel's first appearance and request adjournment for restitution determination and awaiting medical bills, anticipate additional negotiations and expect the case to resolve.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
No contact with Y.L. or his residence. One 20 minute visit to obtain personals with law enforcement.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Liu Yongguang in court, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Liu Yongguang. Interpreter appearing by zoom:  Shirley Barker.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Atty. de Junco requests a signature bond.  Court orders $250.00 signature bond.  Defendant states will return to court when instructed.  Court appoints Atty Brian Borkowicz.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate to be determined.
Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
